comment: Honestly, worst professor ever. Accused me of cheating on an assignment and reported me to the board about it. After that dispute was over and I was cleared of any wrong doing I dropped the class. She requires you to use R, which in my opinion is completely unnecessary, and she is hard to get in touch with as well. Avoid at all costs.

Slow to respond, does not give graded work back so you can learn from your mistakes. You have to schedule an appointment to "go over" the work. Guidance is vague in some areas forcing you to go seek outside sources to learn the material. Questions are not directly answered by the instructor, just tell you about the worksheets in which to look.
She made the class harder then what it needed to be. 75% of the class dropped the class after the first quiz. She has a style of teaching that if you do not follow you will not pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Late to respond to emails. I truly put my best foot forward in this class. This was the first class I had to withdraw from. Does not understand that the quiz format was awful, did not help students, took forever to grade. This professor is literally the hardest I've ever encountered, please avoid at all costs.
I would not recommend taking her for Math 2332, at least for online. There is a large gap between what she teaches and what she asks on the quizzes. The class average was routinely in the 50s.

Doesn't know how to respond to e-mail (In an online class...) When students raise concerns about pacing, her only response is that we weren't trying hard enough. I cannot possibly have a lower opinion for a human being than i do for kimberly gardner. She needs to find a new profession, something where no one has to depend on her. GARBAGE PROFESSOR

Actually a horrible experience that I can't recommend to anyone in good faith. She doesn't respond to emails for weeks, if at all. She is unclear on D2L quizzes (which account for a large portion of your grade and are vastly different than the assigned homework). More than 19 students failed the first quiz, many getting below a 10%. Seriously avoid

Horrible - avoid at all costs. Complete lack of transparency between material taught and the quiz/exams. Prepare to learn everything yourself from the textbook as she does not teach at all. She expects you to learn a programming language but does not teach you at all.

Teacher that is not there for you. You are just paying her to share a Power Point with class. You have to learn everything on your own. Gives you homework in a programming language but sorry can't teach you the language.

Thought this would be a fairly straightforward course, but this professor made it pretty much impossible with how she could never deliver clear instructions. Also, the lectures did not clarify anything and were mostly just tangents, so there was no hope for success in this course. Just save yourself the trouble and don't take this teacher.

The group projects are graded harshly. If one person fails their section assigned to them, the whole group gets a 70. Also, if she will give the whole group a zero if she thinks there was cheating without speaking to anyone first. Very difficult coding part especially if you've never done it before. 1st withdrawal in 6 semesters of college.

In all honestly, she was a decent person but not a great teacher. A lot of the class was watching her do it then being sent out on your own to do the same. There wasn't really any explanation to as what was going on except a short 15 min presentation in class. When we went online it just got worse and even harder to ask questions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Seems to be an okay teacher. Attendence is a grade so don't skip too much. If you forget to sign in she'll let you come up at the end of class to sign in, but if you don't realize until the next day she's not as forgiving. Also you can't see the answers to your homework so you don't know what you've missed after you've gotten it wrong.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is the nicest professor I have ever met. She wants you to succeed and is very understanding. There are 3 projects all similar and they were hard but they are the same no matter who you take. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: The only class I'd recommend her for is Stat 3010 because it doesn't really require her to teach (you just run code and she helps you with syntax if it doesn't work). Fair grader and she understands that it's just an intro course. Any other class though, DO NOT take her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: For STAT 3010 she's great! For any other class though (even her graduate school class), I would not recommend her. STAT 3010 is a class where all you need is the code from her and she walks around to help troubleshoot if it's not working. At that she's awesome. When it comes to classes that require "actual" teaching though, she's no bueno.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She gives great feedback! She mostly just shows what to do and works with students individually to figure out what they are doing wrong, which is great for an intro statistical coding class. She grades fairly and understands that it is an introductory class. I enjoyed this class

Dr. Gardner was incredible! Dr. Gardner was always available to answer any question I had. The key to passing this class, really any class, is not to procrastinate! Start on your HW as soon as it's assigned and ask questions along the way. This is college don't slack off do the work!

I loved her. 6 quizzes w/ 3 trials (youll get an A). They are based off the manual (which she provides). 2 Hw. 1 final project. Shes there to help, she funny in my opinion. She took attendance but it didnt count for anything. The classes is basically her going over a ppt but you doing it along side. Shes very helpful. Again, I loved this class!

took a four week stat course with her over the summer. No feedback on anything and no discussions so I can't really say if she's good or not. Homework was heavy. I pretty much had to teach myself everything. The test was so different from the HW I got really stumped. I would get 100s on HW and 60s-80s on tests. Luckily she gave 20 bonus points
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Is obviously counting down to retirement (even though it is 5 years away). Very little feedback. Midterm was way too much material for the 1 hour given. Very little guidelines on last project (which was 25% of grade). Major topics left uncovered and wanted students to teach each other so she wouldn't have to be bothered. HW corrected by SW.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hard freaking class. You will have to study 8+ hours for each test to maybe get a B. Luckily she curves the final big time and will reward you bonus points at the end of the semester. Very hard material with hard tests but if you dont give up youll pass.

I took her for an online statistics class this summer. The class average for the final was a 51%, and the grade was work 1/4 of your entire grade. I made 100% on all of my other assignments and came out with a B. Tough class, and I hate that almost all of my class failed the entire course!! Something isn't right there.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Gardner is a nice person and cares about statistics and her students. She knows her stuff too. However, two tests and two papers count for your whole grade in this class. That was an issue for me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This has got to be the worst professor I have seen. DO NOT TAKE.  She only gives grades back on material and does not release quizzes back to you after taking them. The grading scale for this: she will drop your 2 highest grades for your final average?? Lectures are terrible she also gives you a pretest for every chapter that will count for average
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Grades on rubric but does not give it to you. No feed, and when asked for feedback does not give you what you did wrong, so you will probably do it wrong again. missed over a quarter of the class, yes 5 weeks of class. Got an A, but not worth it. DO not take if you do not have to.
HORRIBLE!! Had to teach myself how to do everything! All she does is read straight from the book. Does not answer questions and cancels class without notice. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!

Dr. Gardner is very intelligent and knows the subject well. Weaker students may find her intimidating because she holds you accountable for learning. The pace of the course was a little fast, but hey, its college.  She was available during office hours and by appointment. Her classes are well organized. Go to class prepared. Take her advice.

Notesconcepts checks were the bulk of the grade. The group project is designed for two people so you need a fairly good understanding of the material to contribute to the project. Very nice as a person but the material being taught was definitely difficult to understand.

The worst professor I've ever taken. DO NOT TAKE! I did well in STAT 3010 but... She seems uninterested in teaching, reads from book and doesn't help. Don't ask questions unless you want to feel stupid. Don't expect a fair grade because guess what? That 20% of your grade report has a rubric- but you can't see it until it's graded oh and NO FEEDBACK

This is the worst professor I've ever had.  I earned A's in all 4 of my other classes SP 14 semester when I took her class. Out of the first 15 scheduled class meetings, 8 were cancelled, 3 circumstantially by snow and 5 by what I guess was her lack of interest.  You may as well take the course online  because she teaches you nothing

Do not get me wrong, she was a nice person who could joke around, but she seemed to think that her class was the only class that actually mattered.  Her style of teaching took the whole semester to learn, and she was pretty dismissive when it came to most student questions. I felt dumb the whole first quarter due to my lack of knowledge in stat.

Probably the worst professor I've ever had. Not helpful and very rude when asking questions. I'm a straight A student and I really struggled with this class. Be prepared to spend hours studying with no help from her. She will have no problem failing you. DO NOT TAKE HER.

This is the hardest class I have ever taken. Dr. Gardner strongly believes in letting you answer your own questions. While I understand that there is a place for this philosophy in teaching it was very discouraging. Prepare to teach yourself and ensure you have at least 10 hours a week to study for this class. She is a nice person though.

Prof Gardner lets you do your own teaching. Her grading sucks. She’s not very understanding of students concerns(can be dismissive). Goes on and on about how “in high school” this and that... Has the potential be a good teacher once she realizes most students just want to PASS a class. I’d never take her again...She’s a nice person though
She does not know how to teach. Do not take unless you want to be teaching yourself.
This class is challenging, but she is a great teacher. She is very helpful and knowledgeable. I would take her again in a heartbeat.
Her lesson was good, but it was not enough for tests. 9 students dropped this class, 3 students didn't pass.

This class was very difficult for me. Proof writing is very abstract math, and there is plenty of that here. She is very pleasant and easy going, but I' not sure she relates the material well during class. Did some office hours, which helped, but difficult with a full schedule. I'm just glad it's over!
This class is hard as heck, but she does a great job of helping (especially during office hours). I would definitely take her again (just not MATH 3390).

Wow what a class.  She was the one of the best teachers I have had.  Really tough material, alot to learn alot to know, test are difficult, projects are hard too, gets better towards the end.  You MUST study. She is cool and too the point teaches material but you have to understand it by studing. Strap your chin strap or you might loose your head.

She is extremely helpful and will explain everything to you. She may seem hard in class but her tests are pretty fair if you have studied alot. Its college... you have to study hard if you want to do well. Some of the class doesnt seem to understand this and thus does poorly. Would definitly take Dr. Gardner again.

very nice, very helpful. class is extremely difficult and most of the class does poorly on the tests and quizes.She is a good teacher and gives lots of examples in class, the material covered is just very hard. study and practice and you will pass. much better than derado (the only other prof for 3390)!
